com.jivesoftware.selenium.pagefactory.framework.pages

Interface Page

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SubPage, TopLevelPage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseSubPage, BaseTopLevelPage

    public interface Page

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SeleniumActions getActions()
      Get the SeleniumActions for the current page and browser, for how to interact with the page using Selenium.
      org.openqa.selenium.By getPageIdentifier()
      A Selenium Locator that uniquely identifies a page as being successfully loaded.
      void initSubPages()
      How to initialize sub-page fields defined with the @SubPage annotation
      void pageLoadHook()
      Override this to have a page do something different when a page is loaded.
      void refreshElements()
      Call this if a Page has been refreshed by javascript, so it has stale WebElement member variables.
      void refreshPage()
      Call this to do a full page refresh with the browser, and refresh the web elements as well.
      void setActions(SeleniumActions actions)
      Set the selenium actions.

    • Method Detail

      • getActions

        SeleniumActions getActions()
        Get the SeleniumActions for the current page and browser, for how to interact with the page using Selenium.

      • setActions

        void setActions(SeleniumActions actions)
        Set the selenium actions.

      • pageLoadHook

        void pageLoadHook()
        Override this to have a page do something different when a page is loaded. Make sure to call super.pageLoadHook(), since the BasicPage class defines the check that the page identifier is present.

      • getPageIdentifier

        @Nullable
org.openqa.selenium.By getPageIdentifier()
        A Selenium Locator that uniquely identifies a page as being successfully loaded. Return null to not verify any element is present on page load.

      • initSubPages

        void initSubPages()
        How to initialize sub-page fields defined with the @SubPage annotation

      • refreshElements

        void refreshElements()
        Call this if a Page has been refreshed by javascript, so it has stale WebElement member variables. This is useful when a method of a Page class performs actions requiring multiple refreshes. In other situations, you can just use Browser#refreshPage() to get an entirely new Page instance.

      • refreshPage

        void refreshPage()
        Call this to do a full page refresh with the browser, and refresh the web elements as well.
